Furthermore, it is crucial to explore the intended purpose and benefits of installing bike lanes in New York. Bike lanes aim to promote sustainable transportation, reduce traffic congestion, and provide a safer environment for cyclists. These benefits are part of a broader effort to create a more livable and environmentally friendly city. 

If the bike lanes fulfill their intended purpose and provide tangible benefits in terms of reducing traffic congestion and promoting sustainable transportation, they may still be considered effective, even if there are some parking challenges. Without a comprehensive assessment, it is premature to conclude that New York's bike lanes are not working solely based on the parking problems they may cause.
